course_description: This course is designed to give students an understanding of what modern corporate espionage is and how these matters are handled by practicing lawyers. These matters are technologically complex (e.g., involving digital forensics experts, etc.) and involve multiple substantive legal areas (e.g., advanced civil procedure intellectual property, labor and employment, antitrust, etc.). The course is designed in two parts.
sections: Class Nbr: 5284, Section #: 001, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: Th 2-4p, Instructor: J. Gibbs, Status: Open
